2. Hardware Drivers¶

Before installing the plethora of software on this new Windows system, let’s make sure all of the hardware drivers and other related files are installed and up to date.

2.1. Razer Hardware¶

This is for the keyboard, mouse, and mousepad and is straightforward enough. Just download the Synapse 3 driver + configuration tool and install it like normal. Sign in to Razer (1Password will help here) to possibly sync settings that were saved in their cloud.

2.2. Logitech Webcam¶

This one is not quite as straightforward, as Logitech makes three different software packages available and doesn’t really do a good job differentiating between them. To the best of my knowledge, we only need the G Hub software, but it cannot hurt to also install Logitech Capture and Camera Settings as well.

All three software packages (and others) can be found on the same page.

2.3. Stream Deck¶

There will be more to setting up the Elgato Stream Deck later, but for now, let’s just get its driver software installed.

2.4. Oculus Rift¶

Download the original Rift software and install it. Sign in with our Oculus account (thank you, 1Password).

Before letting it synchronize purchased software, make sure to set the location for that software. Go to Settings ‣ General ‣ Libray Locations and hit the Edit button. Choose the drive for the Oculus games (currently G:) and either create the Oculus Apps folder or choose it if it already exists. If the latter is true, then Oculus should begin recognizing the software that’s already installed there. It may need to be given a little kick, however, by going to each game in the Oculus interface and telling it to download them.

Feel free to add other game locations, too. I currently also have some Oculus apps under D:\Oculus Apps, so I have two entries under Libray Locations.

2.5. Scanner¶

The CanoScan LiDE 300’s driver software is a bit weird, as it is called “Canon IJ Scan Utility.” Regardless, download it from the Canon site and install it.

The last time I checked, there were two drivers available. I’m pretty sure that we only need the first one, which is the newer and larger file, and even mentions the IJ Scan Utility.
